Dialogue: Everybody stay calm. We're all going to die!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Everyone in! Now.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: C'mon. Put some back into it people!

Speaker: cyclops
Dialogue: Yee-haw! Ow.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: We don't have time. Now go!

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Quickly ladies!

Speaker: gingerbread man
Dialogue: We'll hold them off as long as we can!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Where are Shrek and Fiona?

Speaker: gingerbread man
Dialogue: Name doesn't ring a bell.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: I suggest you freaks cooperate with the new King of Far Far Away.

Speaker: gingerbread man
Dialogue: The only thing you're ever gonna be King of is "King of the Stupids."

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Hook!

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Right!

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Avast, ye cookie!

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Start talkin'!

Speaker: muffin man
Dialogue: Gingy!

Speaker: gingerbread man
Dialogue: Papa!

Speaker: teacher
Dialogue: Settle down, now.

Speaker: gingerbread man
Dialogue: "On the Good Ship Lollypop, It's a sweet trip, To the candy shop, Where the Bon Bons play, On the sunny beach of Peppermint Bay.."

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: You! You can't lie. So tell me puppet... Where is Shrek?!

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: Well, I don't know where he's not.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: You're telling me you don't know where Shrek is?

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: It wouldn't be inaccurate to assume that I couldn't exactly not say that is or isn't almost partially incorrect.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: So you do know where he is!

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: On the contrary, I'm possibly more or less, not definitely rejecting the idea, that in no way, with any amount of uncertainty that...

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Stop it.

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: If that indeed wasn't where he isn't. Even if he wasn't not where I knew he was could mean that I wouldn't completely not know where he wasn't.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: He's bringing back the next heir?

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Hook! Get rid of this new "King."

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Right!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: But bring Shrek to me. I have something special in mind for him.

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: He'll never fall for your tricks!

Speaker: wolf
Dialogue: Oh boy.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: I can't believe it... me a King? I...I mean I knew I came from royalty and all, but I just figured everyone forgot about me.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh no, in fact, the King asked for you personally.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Really? Wow! Look, I know it's not all gonna be fun and games.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: It really is all fun and games, actually. Sure, you have to knight a few heroes, launch a ship or two. By the way, make sure you hit the boat just right with the bottle.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Boat with the bottle? Any idiot can hit a boat with a bottle.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Well, I've heard it's harder than it looks.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Whoa!! This is gonna be huge. Parties, princesses, castles... princesses.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: It's gonna be great, Artie. You'll be living in the lap of luxury. They got the finest chefs around waiting for you to place your order.

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: And fortunately you'll have the royal food tasters.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Oh yeah? What do they do?

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: They taste the food before the King eats, to make sure it's not poisoned.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Poisoned?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Or too salty!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. You'll be safe and sound with the help of your body guards.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Body guards?

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: All of them, willing at a moment's notice to lay down their own lives out of devotion to you.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Si, and the whole kingdom will look to you for wisdom and guidance.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Just make sure they don't die of famine.

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Or plague.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Oh, plague is bad.

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: The coughing, the groaning, the festering sores.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh! Festering sores! Hey, you are one funny kitty cat.

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: What did I say?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: We don't want Artie here getting the wrong idea.

Speaker: all
Dialogue: Whoa!

Speaker: ship captain
Dialogue: Whoa! Oh, there goes my hip.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Artie!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: What does it look like?!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: This really isn't up to you!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: But I don't know anything about being King!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: You'll learn on the job!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Whoaaa!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Sorry to disappoint you, but I'm going back!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Back to what? Being a loser?!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Look what I did? Who's holding the wheel chief?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Shrek!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: How humiliating...

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh, nice going, Your Highness.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Oh, so now it's "Your highness?" What happened to "loser?" Huh?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Hey, if you think this is getting you out of anything, well it isn't. We're heading back to Far Far Away one way or another, and you're gonna be a father!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: A-hem. You just said father...

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: You're... I said king. You're gonna be King!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: "You're gonna be King!" Yeah right.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Where do you think you're going?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Far Far Away... from you!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: You get back here young man and I mean it!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Uh boss, I don't think he's coming back and maybe it's for the best. He is not exactly king material.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: When were you planning on telling him that you were really supposed to be King?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh c'mon, now why would I do that? Besides, he'll be ten times better at it than me.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Hey, woah ho ho, Shrek. Then you're gonna have to change your tactics if you want to get anywhere with this kid.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: You're right, Donkey.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: What about this?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Shrek!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh c'mon. It's just a joke.  Still...

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Listen Artie...

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I mean, if it doesn't groove or what I'm saying ain't straight trippin', just say, oh no you didn't, you know, you're gettin' on my last nerve. And then I'll know it's... then I'll know it's whack--

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: SOMEBODY HELP! I'VE BEEN KIDNAPPED BY A MONSTER TRYING TO RELATE TO ME!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Artie! Wait!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: C'mon! C'mon! Help! Help! Hello?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: AHHHH!

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: I knew I should of gotten that warranty!

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: AHH! Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Mr. Merlin?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: You know this guy?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Yeah. He was the school's magic teacher until he had his nervous breakdown.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Uh, technically I was merely a victim of a level three fatigue, and at the request of my therapist and the school authorities, I have retired to the tranquility of nature to discover my divine purpose.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Now, can I interest anyone in a snack or beverage?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Uh, no.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Sure you don't wanna try my famous rock au-gratin?

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: It's organic!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh, thanks, I just ate a boulder on the way in. What we need are directions back to Far Far Away.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: What's with the "we"? Who said I was going with you?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh, I did. Cause there's a lot of people counting on you so don't try and weasel out of it.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: If it's such a great job, why don't you do it?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Understand this kid, it's no more Mr. Nice Guy from here on out!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Oh, so that was your "Mr. Nice Guy?"

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I know, and I'm gonna miss him.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: You know what? Why don't you go terrorize a village and leave me alone?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh, is that some kind of crack about ogres? You get your royal highness to Far Far Away before I kick it there.  Now which way am I kicking?

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Oh, I could tell you. But since you're in the midst of self- destructive rage spiral it would be karmic-ly irresponsible.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Self-destructive ra...  Look, are you gonna help us or not?

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Most definitely, but only after you take the journey to your soul.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Yeah, I don't think so.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Look pal, it's either that or some primal scream therapy. Ahhhhhhhhhh!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Alright, alright... journey to the soul...

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Now all of you, look into the "Fire of Truth" and tell me what you see! Yah! Ha!  Woo-looo-looo-looo!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Ooo! Charades! Okay, I see a dutch fudge torte with cinnamon swirls.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Okay. Monster, go for it.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I see a rainbow pony.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Excellent work!  Now! The boy!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: This is lame.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Ow!

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: You're lame! Now just go for it.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Okay. There's a baby bird and a father bird sitting in a nest.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Yes! Stay with it! Stay with it!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Wait, the dad just flew away. Why did he leave the little bird all alone?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: It's trying to fly, but it doesn't know how to. It.. it's gonna fall!

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Whew, proper head case you are, aren't you? Really messed up. Whoa.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, okay. I get it. The bird's me. My dad left. So what?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Look Artie...um-

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Just thought I might help set the mood! Y'know for your big heart to heart chat!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I know what it's like to not feel ready for something.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Even ogres get scared...you know, once in a while.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: I know you want me to be king, but I can't. I'm not cut out for it and I never will be, alright?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: My dad wasn't really the fatherly type either.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Well, I doubt he was worse than mine.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh yeah? My father was an ogre. He tried to eat me.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Now, I guess I should have seen it coming. He used to give me a bath in barbecue sauce and put me to bed with an apple in my mouth.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Okay... I guess that's... pretty bad.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: You know, it may be hard to believe what with my obvious charm and good looks, but people used to think that I was a monster. And for a long time, I believed them.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: You know, you're okay, Shrek.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: You just need to do a little less yelling and use a little more soap.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Thanks Artie.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: The soap's because you stink. Really bad.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Yeah. I got that.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Oh this place is filthy. I feel like a hobo.

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: I'm sorry but this just isn't working for me.

Speaker: sleeping beauty
Dialogue: Everything's always about you, isn't it? It's not like your attitude is helping, Snow.

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: Well maybe it just bothers you that I was voted fairest in the land.

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: You mean in that rigged election?

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: Oh, give me a break.  "Rapunzel, Rapunzel, let down thy golden extensions!"

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Ladies, let go of your petty complaints and let's work together.

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: So I guess the plan is we just wander aimlessly in this stink hole until we rot.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: No, we're gonna get inside and find out what Charming's up to.

Speaker: doris
Dialogue: I know he's a jerk and everything, but I gotta admit, that Charming makes me hotter than July.

Speaker: sleeping beauty
Dialogue: Ew!

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: Ugh.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: That's it!

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: Come on, this way!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Rapunzel. Wait!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Charming, let go of her.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: But why would I want to do that?

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: Grrrr!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Woof!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Say hello ladies, to the new Queen of Far Far Away.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Yaaaaaaaaay!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Rapunzel, how could you?

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: Jealous much?

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Soon you'll be back where you started... scrubbing floors or locked away in towers; that is, if I let you last the week.

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: But Pooky, you promised you wouldn't hurt them!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Not here, "kitten whiskers." Daddy will discuss it later. Now forgive us, we have a show to put on.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Shrek will be back soon Charming, and you'll be sorry.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Sorry? Don't you realize --once Shrek sets foot in Far Far Away he's doomed?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Ow!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Ahhh!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Look out! They've got a piano!

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Kill `em all. Except the fat one.

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: King Charming has something special in mind for you, ogre.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: "King Charming?"

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Attack!

Speaker: pirates
Dialogue: AAAARGH!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Artie, Duck!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Ahhh!

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Ha-ha! Argh!

Speaker: pirates
Dialogue: Argh! Argh!

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Ready the plank!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Shrek!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Help!

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Ya cowards!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: What has Charming done with Fiona?

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: She's gonna get what's coming to her.

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: Ahhh.  And there ain't nothing you can do to stop him!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: We've got to save her!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: But she's so far far away!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Get yourself back to Worcestershire, kid.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: No, Shrek. Hold on a second. I've got an idea.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: I'm a buzzing bee, buzz, buzz, buzz...

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Mr. Merlin, they need a spell to get them...I mean, us, back to Far Far Away.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Forget it. I don't have that kind of magic in me anymore, kid. How about a hug instead? Hmm? That's the best kind of magic.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Mr. Merlin please. I know you can DO IT-

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: I said, forget it!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: BUT-

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Oh. What, what's with you?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: It's just so hard. You know? They really need to get back `cause their kingdom's in trouble `cause there's a really bad man and it's just so hard...

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: C'mon, take it easy.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: No! I don't think you understand! There's a mean person doing mean things to good people-

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh, have a heart old man!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: And they really need your help to get them back! So why won't you help them?

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Uh, Okay... I'll go and get my things.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Piece of cake.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Well, well, well. You want some eggs with that ham?

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Now, I am a little rusty, so there could be some side effects.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Side effects!?

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Don't worry, whatever it is, no matter how excruciatingly painful it may be, it'll wear off eventually... I think.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Ah!

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Oops.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Are you sure this is a good idea?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Look, if Artie trusts him, that's good enough for me. Even if his robe doesn't quite cover his-

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Alacraticious expeditious, a zoomy zoom zoom. Let's help our friends get back, um... soon!

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Woah! It worked!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Donkey?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: What? Is there something in my teeth?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Oh no!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: I've been abracadabra'd into a fancy feasting second rate sidekick.

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: At least you don't look like some kind of bloated roadside piata. You really should think about going on a diet!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Yeah, and you should think about getting yourself a pair of pants! I feel all exposed and nasty.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Oh, so you two think this is funny?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: I'm really sorry guys.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Don't be! You got us back kid.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow. How in the Hans Christian Andersen am I supposed to parade around in these goofy boots?

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Be very careful with those - HEE HAW!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: They were made in Madrid by the finest- HEE HAW!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Oh, you'll learn to control that.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Seriously man, you need some comfort inserts or arch supports or something.  Woah!

Speaker: evil witches
Dialogue: Woohoo!!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Pinocchio?

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: Shrek!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Pinocchio!

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: Help me!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: What's happened?

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: Charming and the Villains have taken over everything! They attacked us but Fiona and the Princesses got away. And now she's- -

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: She's what?! She's what!?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Puss, loan me five bucks!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: C'mon Puss, you heard the man, help a brother out.

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Do you see any pockets on me?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Hold on a second.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Aha!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: I had no idea ...really ...I swear.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Quick, Pinocchio. Where is Fiona?

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: Charming's got her locked away some place secret. You gotta find him! He's probably getting ready for the SHOWWWW---

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Wait, wait, wait! Pinocchio! What show?

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: It's A Happily Ever After, After All!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Shrek's final performance.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Whoa, Shrek! You didn't tell us you were in a play.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Well I guess I've been so busy I forgot to mention it!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Don't worry, Jefe. I got this.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Look, don't you know who he thinks he is? How dare you?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Donkey, we're dealing with amateurs.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: He's a star people! Hello?! I'm so sorry about this Mr. Shrek.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I'm gonna lose it!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: I assume you have everything ready for tonight! You did get the list for the dressing room?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Yeah, the breakfast croissants stuffed with seared sashimi tuna. Oh, and please tell me you at least have the saffron corn with the jalapeno honey butter cause our client cannot get into his proper emotional state without his jalapeno honey butter.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I just lost it!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Oh, we'll have much to say to Nancy, I promise!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: With this sword, I do- No.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: With this sword, I do smote thee!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Is that the right word? "Smote?" "Smooote." Is that even a word actually? Maybe I should just smite him.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Let's try this again. Now...

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Ooh!!!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: I say...  "Finally the Kingdom will get the happily ever after they deserve, die Ogre", blah, blah, blah...

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Oh! It just doesn't feel real enough yet!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Who told you to stop dancing?!

Speaker: cyclops
Dialogue: Uh... Wink and turn, wink and turn.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: And what are you laying around for? Get up! Honestly.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Our happily ever after is nearly complete, mummy. And I assure you, the people of this kingdom will pay dearly for every second we've had to wait.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Break a leg. Or, on second thought, let me break it for you.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Thank goodness you're here. I was beginning to think you might not make it back in... time.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Where's Fiona?

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Don't worry. She and the others are safe. For now.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Ow.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Let me guess... Arthur?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: It's Artie, actually.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: This boy is supposed to be the new King of Far Far Away?

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: How pathetic! Now, stand still so I won't make a mess.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Charming, stop! I'm here now, you got what you wanted. This isn't about him.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Then who's it about? I'm supposed to be King, right?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: You weren't really next in line for the throne, okay? I was.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: But you said the King asked for me personally.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Not exactly.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: What's that supposed to mean?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Look, I said whatever I had to say, alright! I wasn't right for the job, I just needed some fool to replace me, and you fit the bill. So just go!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: You were playing me the whole time.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: You catch on real fast kid... Maybe you're not as big of a loser as I thought.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: You know, for a minute there, I actually thought you -

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: What? That he cared about you? He's an ogre. What did you expect?

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: You really do have a way with children, Shrek.

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: Had we just stayed put like I suggested, we could be sipping tea out of little heart-shaped cups...

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Yeah... yeah, heart shaped cups.

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: Eating crumpets smothered with loganberries.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Yeah... loganberries.

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: Shut up Cindy.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Yeah, shut up.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Just stay out of this!

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: Who cares who's running the kingdom anyway?

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: I care.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: And you should all care too.

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Hey, hey, hey, hey.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Yeah, and I have your badge number, "TIN CAN-"

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Princess?!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Puss?!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Lo siento, Princessa, but I am Puss, stuck here inside this hideous body.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: And I'm me!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: BUT YOU'RE-

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: I know, I know. Everything's a little fruity in the loops right now. But what happened is, we went to high school, the boat crashed, and we got "bippity-bopity-booped" by the "Magic Man."

Speaker: doris
Dialogue: You poor sweet things.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I don't get it.

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: The cat turned into a little horse that smells like feet. What's to get?

Speaker: sleeping beauty
Dialogue: Huh? Who dat?

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Where's Shrek?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Charming's got him, Princess. And he plans on killing Shrek tonight in front of the whole kingdom.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Alright everyone, we need to find a way out, now.

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: You're right.  Ladies, assume the position!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: sleeping beauty
Dialogue: Waiting to be rescued.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: You have got to be kidding me.

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: Well, what do you expect us to do? We're just four...  I mean, three, super hot princesses, two circus freaks, a pregnant ogre and an old lady.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Hmmm. Excuse me. Old lady coming through.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Hiiiyyyiiiaaaah!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Mom!?

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Well, you didn't actually think you got your fighting skills from your father, did you?

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: Excuse me, I think there's still one more.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Hmmmm.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Hiiiiyah!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Why don't you just lie down?

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Okay girls, from here on out, we're gonna take care of business ourselves.

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen. The Far Far Away Theatre at the Charming Pavilion is proud to present: "It's a Happily Ever After, After All."

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oww, easy.

Speaker: cyclops
Dialogue: Sorry. I guess I was just showing off for the little one.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: cyclops
Dialogue: It's "Bring your kids to work day." C'mere beautiful.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Well... she's got your eye.

Speaker: cyclops
Dialogue: Who woulda thought a monster like me deserves something as special as you?

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: "Ahh ha ha ha haa."

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: "Ha ha ha ha haaaa. Little birdies take wing, flitting down from the trees they appear, and to chirp in my ear."

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: "All because I sing. Ahh ha ha ha ha haaa."

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: "Ahh ha ha ha ha haaa."

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: "Ha ha ha ha ha haaaaaaa!"

Speaker: snow white
Dialogue: Ahhaha!! Ahhaha!!!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Move it! Go! Go! Go!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: My babies!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Help! Ow!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: doris
Dialogue: Hey. How's it going?

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: "O" to the "K." The coast has cleared.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: All right people, let's do this thing! Go Team Dy-No-Mite!!

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: I thought we agreed we would go by the name of "Team Super Cool."

Speaker: gingerbread man
Dialogue: As I recall it was "Team Awesome."

Speaker: wolf
Dialogue: I voted for "Team Alpha Wolf Squadron."

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Alright! Alright! Alright! From henceforth we are to be known as "Team Alpha Super Awesome Cool Dynomite Wolf Squadron."

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Artie!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Wait, wait, wait, wait wait. Hey! Where is the fire, Senor?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Oh please, don't act so innocent. You both knew what was going on the whole time and you kept it to yourself.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Artie, it's not like it seems.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: It's not? I think it seems pretty clear. He was using me. That's all there is to it.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Using you? Man, you really don't get it!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Shrek only said those things to protect you!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Charming was going to kill you Artie. Shrek saved your life.

Speaker: rumplestiltskin
Dialogue: Cue the spot!

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: "I wait alone up here. I'm trapped another day. Locked up here - please set me free. My new life I almost see, A castle, you and me. Yes, a castle you and me..."

Speaker: rumplestiltskin
Dialogue: Cherubs!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "Tis I! Tis I! Upon my regal steed! Princess, my love, at last you shall be freed!"

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "I'm strong and brave, and dashing my way there! With speed! With might! With soft and bouncy hair!"

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "Through the blistering desert..."

Speaker: evil trees
Dialogue: "Hot!"

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "Across the stormiest sea."

Speaker: evil dwarfs
Dialogue: "Wet!"

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "Facing creatures so vile!"

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "So you can gaze upon me!"

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: "I knew you'd come for me. And now we finally meet."

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "I knew you'd wait. And from my plate of love you'd eat."

Speaker: mabel
Dialogue: Roar! Roar!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "Who is this terrible ugly fiend who so rudely intervened?"

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: "Oh please, rescue me!"

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "Fear thee not Honey Lamb! I will slice this thing up like a HAM!"

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh boy.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: You are about to enter a world of pain with which you are NOT-  "FamiliaAAAAAAR!"

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Well it can't be anymore painful than the lousy performance you're giving.

Speaker: rumplestiltskin
Dialogue: "Prepare foul beast."

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: "Prepare foul beast, your time is done."

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oooh, if you don't mind could you kill me, and then sing?

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Be quiet!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Oh, come on, I'm just havin' fun with ya. That's actually a very nice leotard.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Do they come in men's sizes?

Speaker: hook
Dialogue: He, he. Now that be funny.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: ENOUGH!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Now you'll finally know what it's like to have everything you've worked for, everything that's precious to you taken away.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Ahhhhh!

Speaker: dragon
Dialogue: Roar!

Speaker: wolf
Dialogue: Arg.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Pray for mercy from...

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: ...Puss!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: And Donkey!

Speaker: pinocchio
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Hi honey! Sorry we're late. You okay?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Much better, now that you're here.

Speaker: audience
Dialogue: Awwwwwww!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: So Charming, you wanna let me out of these so we can settle this ogre to man?

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Oooh, that sounds fun. But I have a better idea!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Fiona!

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: No! Let go of me!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: You will not ruin things this time ogre.  Kill it!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Everybody stop!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Oh, what is it now?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Artie?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Who really thinks we need to settle things this way?

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: You're telling me you just want to be Villains your whole lives?

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: But we are Villains. It's the only thing we know.

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Didn't you ever wish you could be something else?

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: You morons! Don't listen to him! ATTACK THEM-

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: Okay, fair enough. You're right. I'm not a talking tree. But, ya know, a good friend of mine once told me that just because people treat you like a villain, or an ogre...

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: ... or just some loser...

Speaker: rumplestiltskin
Dialogue: Me?

Speaker: other pirates
Dialogue: Get `im lads!

Speaker: artie
Dialogue: No, no, no! What I mean is: each of you is standing in your own way!

Speaker: villains
Dialogue: Oooooooh!

Speaker: headless horseman
Dialogue: I've always wanted to play the flute.

Speaker: evil queen
Dialogue: I`d like to open up a spa in France.

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: I grow daffodils!

Speaker: captain hook
Dialogue: And they're beautiful!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Aaaahhhh!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: A new era finally begins!

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Now, all of you, bow before your king!

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Ah-hem.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: This was supposed to be my happily ever after.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Well I guess you need to keep looking...

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: ...cause I'm not giving up mine.

Speaker: prince charming
Dialogue: Mommy?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: It's yours if you want it, you know, but this time it's your choice.

Speaker: all
Dialogue: Ar-tie! Ar-tie! Ar-tie! Ar-tie!

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Uh, excuse me, that's my seat.

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Okay, senor hocus-y pocus-y. The time has come to rectify some wrongs!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Although I have been enjoying these "cat baths."

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Please say you didn't.

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Uh... alright, alright...look..

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: You're gonna feel a little pinch, and possibly some lower intestinal discomfort, but this should do the trick.

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: Are you..?

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: I'm me again!

Speaker: puss
Dialogue: And I am not you!

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Alright!

Speaker: merlin
Dialogue: Oops. Ah, never mind.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: What'd I tell ya? I think the kid's going to be a great King.

Speaker: fiona
Dialogue: Well, for what it's worth, you would have too.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I have something much more important in mind.

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Ah, finally.

Speaker: ogre babies
Dialogue: Da da.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Hey! I smell Shrek Jr.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Peek-a-boo. Peek-a-boo.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Bouncy, bouncy, bouncy boy.

Speaker: donkey
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: nanny dwarf
Dialogue: Where's the baby?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: Well, what shall we do now?

Speaker: shrek
Dialogue: I got it.
